entry.title: Erfassung Wertkorrektur vom ERP Bestand - ohne den EWM Bestand zu bewegen
entry.content:
Hallo, 

wir müssen bei uns bei 394 Identnummern, die Bewertungsklassen ändern, um das möglich machen zu können, muss ich den ERP Bestand ausbuchen und wieder einbuchen. 
Ich bin erst seit 2 Monaten bei SAP dabei und mich verwirrt diese Anleitung ein wenig: 
2178045 - Alternativen zur Erfassung von Wareneingangskorrekturen im EWM - SAP for Me

 

Hier gibt es so viele Auswahlmöglichkeiten, was ist hier das richtige? 

Ich bitte euch um Unterstützung! Gegebenenfalls kennt jemand bereits die Thematik.

Danke im Voraus! 

Liebe Grüße

David

entry.title: Issue with Automatic Payments
entry.content:
Problem Description
We are currently experiencing issues with the execution of automatic and single payments in SAP. Despite reviewing and adjusting the corresponding configuration, the problem persists. The only temporary solution has been to manually reassign the payable account to each vendor, which is not the expected system behavior, as it should follow the defined hierarchy and execute the payment automatically.

Error Details
When attempting to execute an automatic payment for company code 4802 (Molino San Gerardo) using bank BCOL/1645, the system displays the following error message:

“House bank BCOL/1645 is not assigned to G/L account 11101020 in company code 4802.”

Account 11101020 does not belong to company code 4802 and is not included in the configuration, as confirmed during the review.

This same behavior occurs in other company codes, where the system attempts to use accounts that are not correctly assigned, resulting in similar errors.

Analysis Performed
The following reviews and tests were conducted:

  • Bank G/L accounts: Verified that the G/L accounts assigned to banks for company code 4802 are correctly configured and do not include account 11101020
  • House bank to G/L account assignment: Confirmed that house bank BCOL/1645 is linked to the correct G/L account and not to 11101020.
  • Bank determination for payments: Reviewed the configuration of bank determination for payments, confirming that company code 4802 and house bank BCOL/1645 are correctly parameterized, with no assignment to account 11101020.
    • Search for company code 4802 and house bank BCOL/1645.
    • No assignment to account 11101020 was found.
  • Tests in other company codes: When replicating the process in other company codes, similar errors were obtained, indicating that the issue is not exclusive to one company code.

Temporary Solution Applied
To execute the payment, it is currently necessary to manually assign the bank data in the vendor master record before processing the payment. However, this procedure is not viable for daily operations, as it requires manual intervention for each invoice to be paid.

Additionally, the payment is executed but impacts the statement account instead of the outgoing payment account.It posts to the account ending in 10, whereas it should post to the one ending in 12.

Support Request
We kindly request your support in identifying and correcting the root cause of this behavior so that the system performs automatic payments correctly, following the defined configuration hierarchy and without requiring manual intervention for each invoice.

Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated, as we are about to begin the integration testing phase.

entry.title: Exploring AI in the ERP Ecosystem – Especially in the SAP FICO Space
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I wanted to start an open discussion on how Artificial Intelligence (AI) is shaping the ERP ecosystem, especially in the SAP FICO area.

We all can see that automation and intelligence are becoming core to financial operations — from predictive accounting to intelligent reconciliations, cash forecasting, anomaly detection, and even automated decision support.

But I’m curious to hear from everyone here:

  • How do you see AI blending with traditional FICO processes?

  • What are the most promising areas for AI-driven improvements in Finance and Controlling?

  • Are there real examples where AI has already made a visible impact in your projects?

No specific questions here — just an open space for sharing ideas, thoughts, experiences, and even challenges you’ve faced while exploring or implementing AI capabilities in ERP or FICO.

Looking forward to hearing your perspectives and insights!

Best regards,
Eswar Nekkalapu

entry.title: Configuring SAP Business Workflow for parked documents (FIPP)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

during a SAP S/4HANA implementation, we have the requirement for parked document approvals via SAP Business Workflow (object type FIPP). I need advice on the following issue:

So far, I did the configuration in customizing under ‘Make and Check Settings for Document Parking’, I created the workflow variant, assigned company code and defined release approval paths and procedures for parking documents including mentioning needed subworkflow WS51000020 (FIPP_SUBWFN2, two step approval except initiator). Also, I defined users for release authorizations for each approval level in OBWF. Beforehand, I activated the type linkage in transaction SWE2 for workflow framework WS00400032 for event CREATED as well as event linking in transaction OOCU is activated.

When I create a document with transaction FB01 and save it as completed, I check afterward in FBV3 and see the document is not released as expected. When I check workflow -> workflow overview, I see that workflow is not going through as expected. In display workflow log, I check the error message in work item and it says error in workflow customizing for document parking in OBWE. I checked the transaction and related customizing, but I am unable to find the hidden mistake.

Does anyone have an advice on how to solve this issue? Is there anything else to consider?

Thank you in advance for any advice on this matter

Kind regards

entry.title: Question about tx ABAVN, ABAON, ABZON
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We are currently implementing SAP S4HANA 2023. In transactions ABAVN, ABAON, and ABZON, is it possible to post a fixed asset to more than one ledger?

We have five ledgers, but we need to post to only two, L4 and L5, for several fixed assets. Is it possible to do this in both ledgers, or can it only be done individually per ledger?

In R3, this was possible because it was done by movement type, as it allowed limiting the movement type by valuation area. In S4, movement types cannot be limited to valuation areas.

Our go-live date is January 2026.

Thanks and best regards.

entry.title: Cash Transfer - Batch
entry.content:
Hi,

we are using the Cash Transfer App (ID F0691) to transfer money from one bank account to another bank account. In addition, we are using the Bank Communication Management to create payment batches and send them to the Bank.

The batches are created automatically through the app and includes only one payment. Is it possible to stop the batch process and create batches with more than one payment?

entry.title: Differentiating QM processes for in-house vs. external procurement under Procurement Type “X”
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

We are working on an SAP project for a client who wants to use Procurement Type “X” (both in-house and external procurement) for certain semi-finished and assembly materials.

From the QM side, the client wants to ensure clear differentiation of quality management processes depending on whether the material is produced internally or procured externally.

We are currently analyzing how this can be configured and controlled within SAP ERP.
Some of the main questions we have are:

  1. QM differentiation:

    • How can QM responsibilities, inspection lots, and first article inspections (FAI) be managed separately for in-house vs. externally sourced lots when Procurement Type = “X”?

    • Are there standard configuration options (e.g., inspection types, source-specific QM data, site-specific fields, or custom enhancements) that allow this distinction?

  2. Governance and master data:

    • If Procurement Type “X” is used, what governance mechanisms or procedures do you apply to ensure that QM and SCM responsibilities are clearly separated and audit-compliant?

    • Are there cases where separate material numbers are still recommended for QM control reasons?

Any real-world examples, best-practice setups, or configuration hints from projects where Procurement Type “X” was implemented successfully would be extremely valuable for our analysis.

Thank you very much in advance for your insights!

Best regards,

entry.title: Standard S/4HANA Approach for Leasing Account Determination Without Material or Service Master Data
entry.content:
Hi All,

Is there a standard way in SAP S/4HANA to derive a valuation class  and therefore the correct G/L account via OBYC , for leasing purchase orders without using a material master?

In our scenario, Procurement wants to create leasing POs using free-text or service (item category D) lines only. They do not want to create or duplicate material codes just to drive account determination. However, Finance requires that all leasing-related costs automatically post to a dedicated leasing G/L account for IFRS 16 reporting. This means we need a valuation class to be determined automatically in the PO, even though no material master is used.

Is there a standard S/4HANA configuration approach that allows: PO item category D (Service) No material number in the PO Automatic determination of valuation class based on something like material group Automatic G/L determination through OBYC (GBB/VBR) No enhancements, no BAdIs, no custom fields …essentially allowing Finance to get the correct leasing G/L while Procurement continues using text/service items?

If so, what configuration objects are involved, and are there specific dependencies (e.g., item category, account assignment category, plant, purchasing org) that must be maintained for this to work?”** what is tiltle of that?

entry.title: 運用開始後にチケット：3226691を適用した際の業務影響について。
entry.content:
運用を開始している会計年度バリアントに対して、チケット：3226691 の手順を実施した際の業務影響についてご教示ください。
《チケット内容》
・SE38でPGM（FINS_GENERATE_FISCAL_PERIOD ）を実施

《確認内容》
①実施が必要な会計年度バリアントと不必要な会計年度バリアントの違い（全部対応必要かどうか）
①実施時の業務影響の有無
②業務影響がある場合の詳細内容

entry.title: Chart of Accounts for foreign subsidiaries
entry.content:
Good morning SAP experts ,

We are rolling out our SAP customizations to our foreign subsidiaries , now we are facing a problem : 

In some of the countries , the accounting codes are already determined by government , these accounting codes are different with the chart of accounts of HQ . 

Our subsidiaries don't want to change their accounting codes after they start to use SAP , but the accounting department of HQ wants them to use the same chart of account , so that they can do the consolidation more easily .

Also , in our PL report of HQ , some accounts will appear at different lines based on the "Function Area" ,but some subsidiaries don't want to use "Function Area" , they just separate the account , so we cannot simply create a new chart of account for the subsidiaries and do the 1 on 1 mapping to the HQ chart of account .

  • Here is the question :
    Is there any method for our foreign subsidiaries keep using their accounting codes in SAP ,
    and HQ accounting department also can do the consolidation easily ?

Please help if you have any experiences or solutions , thank you very much .

Best regards

Shi Zhekui

entry.title: Missing "Payment details" tag in XML Facturae (public entity) - DRC SAP PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We are working in this XML: ?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><fe:Facturae xmlns:fe="http://www.facturae.es/Facturae/2009/v3.2/Facturae">

We were trying to send an XML file to FACe. The procedure is now correct, and we can download the XML file and upload it to the FACe website (Spain).

Upon reviewing and comparing the format (with an older version of the client's ERP), we discovered that the <PaymentDetails> tag is missing. This tag contains the bank details where the company wishes to receive payment from the public entity.

Do I need to configure anything else for this bank information to appear in the XML file? I couldn't find any information on this. I tried including the bank details when creating the invoice and also added a custom bank to a business partner's profile, but nothing worked.

I followed the step by step from this website information: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a624a4a6d1d8473eb95fb42660127cfe/93f1698548a14c09947d53fbc1c3423a.html?locale=es-ES&version=2502.500

Thanks for the help!
